resources

Interface Renderable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Resource
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Mesh, Spline
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BezierSpline, CatmullRomSpline, CubeMesh, CubicSpline, QuadMesh, SimpleSpline, StaticMesh

    public interface Renderable
extends Resource
    Interface for meshes and splines.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void afterDraw()
      Operations after draw.
      void beforeDraw()
      Operations before draw, like binding the VAO.
      void draw()
      Draws this Renderable.
      org.joml.Vector3f getAabbMax()
      Returns the axis alligned bounding box's maximum x, y and z values.
      org.joml.Vector3f getAabbMin()
      Returns the axis alligned bounding box's minimum x, y and z values.
      float getFurthestVertexDistance()
      Returns the distance between the origin and the furthest vertex.
      int getVertexCount()
      Returns the Renderable's vertex count.

      • Methods inherited from interface resources.Resource

        getDataSizeInAction, getDataSizeInRam, getResourceId, isUsable, release, update

    • Method Detail

      • getVertexCount

        int getVertexCount()
        Returns the Renderable's vertex count.
        Returns:
        vertex count

      • getFurthestVertexDistance

        float getFurthestVertexDistance()
        Returns the distance between the origin and the furthest vertex. This value is not depends on a GameObject's scale (object space), so if you scale the mesh, this method gives you wrong value. If you want to get the scaled value of the furthest vertex distance (what is depends on the GameObject's scale), use the MeshComponent's or SplineComponent's getScaledFurthestVertexDistance() method.
        Returns:
        furthest vertex distance
        See Also:
        MeshComponent.getRealFurthestVertexDistance(), SplineComponent.getRealFurthestVertexDistance()

      • getAabbMin

        org.joml.Vector3f getAabbMin()
        Returns the axis alligned bounding box's minimum x, y and z values.
        Returns:
        the axis alligned bounding box's minimum x, y and z values

      • getAabbMax

        org.joml.Vector3f getAabbMax()
        Returns the axis alligned bounding box's maximum x, y and z values.
        Returns:
        the axis alligned bounding box's maximum x, y and z values

      • beforeDraw

        void beforeDraw()
        Operations before draw, like binding the VAO.

      • draw

        void draw()
        Draws this Renderable. Note that before calling this method, you should start a shader program, enable vertex attributes, send uniform variables to the GPU and bind this mesh's VAO. Usually only Renderers calls this method.

      • afterDraw

        void afterDraw()
        Operations after draw.
